headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Commissioner Leaving After Six Years of Breakneck Changes
headline.main: F.D.A. Commissioner Leaving After Six Years of Breakneck Changes

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Dr Margaret Hamburg will step down following six-year tenure leading agency through some significant and challenging issues in public health; Hamburg grappled with painkiller abuse, obesity and the rise of electronic cigarettes, and received both praise and criticism for speeding up the approval of medicines.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Margaret Hamburg, who led the Food and Drug Administration for nearly six years, was praised and criticized for speeding the approval of medicines.
docs.snippet: Dr. Margaret Hamburg, who led the Food and Drug Administration for nearly six years, was praised and criticized for speeding the approval of medicines.

headline.print_headline: What Causes Girls to Enter Puberty Early?
headline.main: What Causes Girls to Enter Puberty Early?

byline.original: By LOUISE GREENSPAN and JULIANNA DEARDORFF

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Dr Louise Greenspan and Prof Julianna Deardorff expresses concern that record numbers of grade-school girls are starting puberty early; points out, while research is not yet in on impact of chemicals and hormones in food, two problems with definite link to early puberty are obesity and family stress.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stress and being overweight are the most likely culprits.
docs.snippet: Stress and being overweight are the most likely culprits.

headline.print_headline: Mississippi, a Vaccination Leader, Stands by Its Strict Rules
headline.main: Mississippi, a Vaccination Leader, Stands by Its Strict Rules

docs.abstract: Mississippi bill that would have increased exemptions to its strict vaccine requirement is greatly amended, leaving one of nation's strictest vaccination rules untouched; state reported that almost all of its kindergarten students were adequately immunized in 2013-14 academic year.
docs.lead_paragraph: A bill that would have created a new immunization exemption was heavily amended on Tuesday, leaving the state’s rigid requirements effectively intact.
docs.snippet: A bill that would have created a new immunization exemption was heavily amended on Tuesday, leaving the state’s rigid requirements effectively intact.

docs.abstract: Joggers consistently tended to live longer than people who did not exercise, a new study found. And the slowest runners lived longest of all.
docs.snippet: Joggers consistently tended to live longer than people who did not exercise, a new study found. And the slowest runners lived longest of all.

keywords.value: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
keywords.name: organizations

headline.print_headline: Ireland to Set Minimum Alcohol Price to Curb 'Dangerous' Misuse
headline.main: Ireland to Set Minimum Alcohol Price to Curb 'Dangerous' Misuse

docs.lead_paragraph: Ireland will set a minimum price for alcohol and restrict its marketing to reduce a level of drinking the health minister called a public health emergency.
docs.snippet: Ireland will set a minimum price for alcohol and restrict its marketing to reduce a level of drinking the health minister called a public health emergency.

headline.print_headline: Infections Most Common Cause of Readmissions After Surgery
headline.main: Infections Most Common Cause of Readmissions After Surgery

docs.lead_paragraph: Surgery patients end up back in the hospital most often because of incision infections that don't show up until after they're sent home, according to a study that found unexpected readmission rates vary widely.
docs.snippet: Surgery patients end up back in the hospital most often because of incision infections that don't show up until after they're sent home, according to a study that found unexpected readmission rates vary widely.

headline.print_headline: Toddler Food Often Has Too Much Salt, Sugar, CDC Study Says
headline.main: Toddler Food Often Has Too Much Salt, Sugar, CDC Study Says

docs.lead_paragraph: Many packaged meals and snacks for toddlers contain worrisome amounts of salt and sugar, potentially creating an early taste for foods that may contribute to obesity and other health risks, according to a new government study.
docs.snippet: Many packaged meals and snacks for toddlers contain worrisome amounts of salt and sugar, potentially creating an early taste for foods that may contribute to obesity and other health risks, according to a new government study.
